alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 7:06AM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 12 inches in the valleys and 1 to 2 feet in the mountains above 3500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 55 mph in the mountains Tuesday. Valley wind gusts 20 to 30 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Eastport, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Dobson Pass, Kellogg, Mullan, Athol, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace, Priest River, Clark Fork, Bonners Ferry, Lookout Pass, St. Maries, Sandpoint, Fourth Of July Pass, and Fernwood. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1.
